name: Fingersmith
tagline: Minimal webRTC signalling service for Kranky Geek 2015 - in scala - using fingerprints as IDs. Based on Socko
body:
### Welcome to Fingersmith.
This site is a public repo for experimentation, notes and demos associated with the use of WebRTC fingerprints as addresses.  

### Here are a couple of videos to get you started: 
+ [Yopet.us ](https://yopet.us) - a minimal implementation for use with your feathered of furry friends
+ [Kranky Geek](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TLXmB2TZyZE) - Some background on how and why.

### TLDR;
Using WebRTC fingerprints as addresses in a federated communication system gives easy MiTM protection
and secure P2P communication without the need to trust the federating systems. (You still need to 
trust the javascript of course.) This technique is the subject of a pending patent.

### Authors and Contributors
@steely-glint (Tim Panton) and Westhawk Ltd ( https://www.westhawk.co.uk)
